entries.meaning: (dice games) A situation in the rules of certain dice games where a player is given the option to reroll an undesirable roll of the dice.

verbs.description: reroll (third-person singular simple present rerolls, present participle rerolling, simple past and past participle rerolled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To roll, or roll out, again.
(transitive, intransitive, dice games) To roll (dice) again.
examples: A player who rolls two sixes can reroll the dice for an additional turn.
You can reroll if you don't like your character's initial stats.

entries.meaning: (transitive, programming) To convert (an unrolled instruction sequence) back into a loop.
examples: Their procedure is to unroll the loop once, trace schedule the two iterations, and then reroll the loop into one.
